etymology.description: pictogram: a running man; later addition 止 (“foot”); modern top 夭 simplified to 土 and bottom stylized as 龰; small-seal variant 𧺆.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a person in motion. A ‘foot’ element was later appended to emphasize movement; in regular script the top resembles 土 and the lower part is stylized, but the sense of going/walking remains.

examples.chinese: 时间不早了(時間不早了)，我先走了(我先走了)。
examples.pinyin: Shíjiān bù zǎo le, wǒ xiān zǒu le.
examples.english: It’s getting late; I’ll head out first.

examples.chinese: 他每天走十公里(他每天走十公里)。
examples.english: He walks ten kilometers every day.

examples.chinese: 这台机器不走了(這台機器不走了)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tái jīqì bù zǒu le.
